org.domainobject.util.debug

Class BeanPrinter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.domainobject.util.debug.BeanPrinter

  • public class BeanPrinter
extends Object
    A BeanPrinter recursively dumps the innards of an object you specify to a PrintWriter of your choice.
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BeanPrinter()
      Creates a BeanPrinter that writes to standard out.
      BeanPrinter(PrintWriter printWriter)
      Creates a new BeanPrinter that writes to the specified PrintWriter.
      BeanPrinter(String path)
      Creates a BeanPrinter that writes to the specified file.

    • Method Detail

      • out

        public static void out(Object bean)
        Dumps the specified object using the most recently instantiated BeanPrinter instance. If no BeanPrinter has been instantiated yet, a new one will be created that prints to standard out and uses the default print settings.
        Parameters:
        bean - The object to be printed

      • toString

        public static String toString(Object bean)
        Dumps the specified object to a string.
        Parameters:
        bean - The object to be printed
        Returns:
        The dump

      • dump

        Recursively writes the specified object's state to the chosen PrintWriter.
        Parameters:
        bean - The object whose state to print

      • isShowClassNames

        public boolean isShowClassNames()
        Whether to print the fields' class names.
        Returns:

      • setShowClassNames

        public void setShowClassNames(boolean showClassNames)
        Whether to print the fields' class names. Default true. If false, only the values of the fields are printed, which may result in a more easily readable representation of the bean.
        Parameters:
        showClassNames - Whether to display the class of the bean's fields

      • isShowSimpleClassNames

        public boolean isShowSimpleClassNames()
        Whether to print simple class names or fully qualified class names.
        Returns:

      • setShowSimpleClassNames

        public void setShowSimpleClassNames(boolean showSimpleClassNames)
        Whether to print simple class names or fully qualified class names. By default the fully qualified class name is displayed, except for classes in the java.lang package. These are always printed using their simple names, irrespective of this setting.
        Parameters:
        showSimpleClassNames -

        Returns:

      • setShowRawMaps

        public void setShowRawMaps(boolean showRawMaps)
        Whether to print Map instances like any other object or to print them in a special, more intuitive way. By default maps are printed in a non-standard, more inuitive way.
        Parameters:
        showRawMaps -

      • isShowSimpleMapKeys

        public boolean isShowSimpleMapKeys()
        Whether to print Map keys in a simplified manner.
        Returns:

      • setShowSimpleMapKeys

        public void setShowSimpleMapKeys(boolean showSimpleMapKeys)
        Whether to print Map keys in a simplified manner. Default true. If true, alphanumerical keys will be represented simply by their value (rather than as full-blown objects). For other types of keys, if the key's class overrides toString(), the result of calling toString() is used to display the key. Otherwise the concatenation of the key's class name and object ID is used to display the key. If false, map keys are printed like any other object, which may cause the map as a whole to become unintelligible.
        Parameters:
        showSimpleMapKeys -

      • isShowObjectIds

        public boolean isShowObjectIds()
        Whether to print object IDs.
        Returns:

      • setShowObjectIds

        public void setShowObjectIds(boolean showObjectIds)
        Whether to print an object's identity hash code (retrieved through System.identityHashCode(Object)). Default false. Helpful when trying to spot cyclical references and/or duplicate objects.
        Parameters:
        showObjectIds -

      • isShowStringLength

        public boolean isShowStringLength()
        Whether to print the length of Strings and other CharSequence objects.
        Returns:

      • setShowStringLength

        public void setShowStringLength(boolean showStringLength)
        Whether to print the length of Strings and other CharSequences. Default false.
        Parameters:
        showStringLength -

        public void setPrintGetters(boolean printGetters)
        Whether to print the objects returned by the getter methods. Default false. Any method with zero parameters and a non-void return type is considered a getter.
        Parameters:
        printGetters -

      • getMaxRecursion

        public int getMaxRecursion()
        Sets the maximum number of levels the BeanPrinter will descend into the bean it is printing.
        Returns:

      • setMaxRecursion

        public void setMaxRecursion(int maxRecursion)
        Sets the maximum number of levels the BeanPrinter will descend into the bean it is printing. Default 20. Although the bean printer will usually detect cyclical references, some objects (e.g. from the sun.misc package and bytecode-enhanced JPA objects) respond badly to inspection via the java.lang.reflect package, which is what the BeanPrinter is all about. Therefore a hard cap is also necessary in order to avoid infinite recursion.
        Parameters:
        maxRecursion -

      • getIgnoredPackages

        public HashSet<Package> getIgnoredPackages()
        Get the set of opaque packages.
        Returns:

      • setIgnoredPackages

        public void setIgnoredPackages(HashSet<Package> opaquePackages)
        Determines which packages should be treated as opaque. If a field's type belongs to any of those packages, the field itself will printed, but no recursion into its internals will take place. By default, the following packages are ignored:
        • java.lang
        • java.lang.reflect
        • sun.misc
        Parameters:
        opaquePackages -

      • printOpaque

        public void printOpaque(String packageName)
        Add a package to the set of opaque packages.
        Parameters:
        packageName - The name of the package

      • getIgnoredClasses

        public HashSet<Class<?>> getIgnoredClasses()
        Get the set of opaque classes.
        Returns:

      • setIgnoredClasses

        public void setIgnoredClasses(HashSet<Class<?>> opaqueClasses)
        Determines which classes should be treated as opaque. If a field's type is an opaque classes, or any of its subclasses, the field itself will be printed, but no recursion into its internals will take place.
        Parameters:
        opaqueClasses -

      • printOpaque

        public void printOpaque(Class<?> c)
        Add a class to the set of ignored classes.
        Parameters:
        c -
